example.text: The person arrested was being investigated by the Department of Homeland Security for smuggling "large quantities of fentanyl" from Mexico across the southern border. Now, Drug overdoses are killing Oregon teenagers at a faster rate than any other state.

VISITING WITH STATE LEGISLATORS After wrapping up votes and committee hearings on Wednesday, I was glad to be back in Oregon for a full day of meetings on Thursday. I was able to stop by the state capitol, where I spoke with lawmakers on both sides of the aisle about ways we can work together to help Oregonians.

Failing to act means students are literally stuck paying the price, and that's why I'm honored to help lead this bipartisan legislation. ENSURING STUDENTS DON'T LOSE ACCESS TO FINANCIAL AID Separately, I also joined over two dozen of my colleagues in support of the Family Farm and Small Business Exemption Act this week.

ONE MORE THING I held my first tele-town hall Tuesday evening! I took over a dozen questions on a wide range of topics, including my legislative priorities, tolling, homelessness, infrastructure, veterans, border security, the fentanyl crisis, and more.
On Wednesday, I first had a great conversation with the Oregon Association of Broadcasters. We discussed the Local Radio Freedom Act, NEXTGEN TV, diversity in broadcasting, and more.
